ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did you use larger amounts of drugs or use them for a longer time than you planned or intended?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you try to control or cut down on your drug use but were unable to do it?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you spend a lot of time getting drugs, using them, or recovering from their use?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you have a strong desire or urge to use drugs?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you get so high or sick from using drugs that it kept you from working, going to school, or caring for children?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you continue using drugs even when it led to social or interpersonal problems?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you spend less time at work, school, or with friends because of your drug use?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you use drugs that put you or others in physical danger?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you continue using drugs even when it was causing you physical or psychological problems?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you need to increase the amount of a drug you were taking so that you could get the same effects as before?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did using the same amount of a drug lead to it having less of an effect as it did before?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you get sick or have withdrawal symptoms when you quit or missed taking a drug?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did you ever keep taking a drug to relieve or avoid getting sick or having withdrawal symptoms?
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Which drug caused the most serious problem during the last 12 months? [CHOOSE ONE]
Notes: 1=None; 2=Alcohol; 3=Marijuana (weed); 4=Hashish (hash); 5=Synthetic Marijuana (K2/Spice); 6=Heroin (smack); 7=Fentanyl/Iso; 8=Powder Cocaine (coke); 9=Crack Cocaine (rock); 10=Amphetamines (speed); 11=Methamphetamine (meth); 12=Synthetic Cathinones (Bath Salts); 13=MDMA/GHB/Rohypnol (Ecstasy); 14=Ketamine/PCP (Special K); 15=LSD/Mushrooms (acid); 16=Solvents (paint thinner); 17=Prescription Medications - Depressants; 18=Prescription Medications- Stimulants; 19=Prescription Medications - Opioid Pain Relievers; 20=Other

ElementDescription: Please specify the other drug which caused the most serious problem during the last 12 months:
How often did you use this other drug (specified above) in the past 12 months?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Only a few times; 3=1-3 times per month; 4=1-5 times per week; 5=Daily; [tcu_20] = 20

ElementDescription: How many times before now have you ever been in a drug treatment program?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=1 time; 3=2 times; 4=3 times; 5=4 or more times

ElementDescription: How serious do you think your drug problems are?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=Slightly; 3=Moderately; 4=Considerably; 5=Extremely

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months, how often did you inject drugs with a needle?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Only a few times; 3=1-3 times/month; 4=1-5 times per week; 5=Daily

ElementDescription: How important is it for you to get drug treatment now?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=Slightly; 3=Moderately; 4=Considerably; 5=Extremely
